review: I've been using a Panasonic DMP BDT210 blu-ray player as my steaming source for about 3 years.  It's ok, but it's really slow.  This device, by contrast, is very fast.  There is hardly any delay navigating the menus with the supplied remote or through the Android app, at least when the Stick works...The problem is I've had it hooked up for 4 days and watched about 6 hours of programming and I've had to reset it by disconnecting and reconnecting the power twice.  The first time it was completely non-responsive.  The second time the program I was watching on Netflix kept pausing to buffer.  After the power cycle the Stick lost my Netflix credentials, so I threw up my hands and switched back to the blu-ray, which worked fine.I'll keep the device with the hope that all it needs is a firmware upgrade.
author: Henry May "Henry"

review: So far the FireTV Stick seems to work okay. I love the layout of the menus and the remote it comes with is perfect. I also love the app that lets me control the device with my android phone. My only complaint is that at times the device will lose wifi connection to my network. I thought it was a problem with my wireless router, but all my other devices that are connected to the same wireless network in the same location work perfectly. Eventually after a going to the network setup menu option and making it reconnect the connection will take and be reliable. I am hoping a firmware update will eventually alleviate this issue. Other than the connection issue once you are connected the device works as described. Like I said earlier the menu options are very nice and easy to navigate. It is nice not having to use my xbox or bluray player to connect to Amazon Prime shows. If Amazon fixes the wireless connection issue I wil change the rating.
